reviews.review_msg: This was a really great class! I looked forward to attending this course every week, and it seemed that most of my classmates felt this way as well. He is really passionate about understanding different religions, and has tons of funny stories to tell. There are bi-weekly quizzes on religions, and a couple of papers. Would take again :)
He is soooooo funny. Also a great prof. He is intelligent and shares his knowledge. Great pedagogical skills.
Took through distance education. Overall great course. The exams are straightforward.

Online. Covers a large range of world religions. Aim to do really good on the 2 papers and make sure to participate in both discussions by the due date.. This way you don't have too much pressure for the final (definitions, 2 short essays, and 2 big essays, no MC). Helped to have a higher grade going into the exam. Minimal work, good class

Took it DE. This class should be noted as a W class: 2 papers & the Final (no MT) is strictly written, but you do get the essay question beforehand. Discussions were easy. I had a fairly rude TA (Michael) who kind of talked down to students, but he was frequently available. Maybe it's the way he writes messages?
20% Participation? Yikes...But really nice prof. Be prepared to be called on every class if you have her in your tutorials and even sometime randomly in the giant lecture hall.

I took this class in the spring 2010 semester. The prof was clear and always tried to engage the class in her morning discussions. If you are looking for a class where you do not have to put a lot of effort in, then this is not the class for you. If you know nothing about religion and do not study for the exams, you will probably fail the course.
very knowledgeable prof. really cares about her students. quizzes can be challenging because they are m/c. I learned a lot.  I really enjoyed my first humanities class.
She was my field school director for Prague, and she made it the best experience I've ever had. Highly intellectual, caring, and thoughtful. It was a privilege to be her student.

I had this course online it was good. I had a really dumb TA and then contacted christine to get my work remarked and she moved me from a B to a A! Shes a really nice prof and this course is fun and really opens your mind. Everyone should take this course it relates to so many other subjects

Not taking anything away from her as a prof but the class is simply to broad to cover all major religions. Moreover, the marking is extremely subjective.  Religion spans outside the realm of academia and the authenticity of scholars in religion outside academia have to be taken into account.  This is where Prof Jones and I disagreed.
Amazing prof! Would take another class with her (Y)

Professor Jones was okay. She did not explain all concepts that well. Went a bit too fast. She skips around a lot so it is hard to keep up with what she is talking about. I didn't really enjoy her class.
Took this DE and it was okay. Didn't have any contact with the professor, only with the tutor-marker. Didn't do much work and got a decent mark.

I would take anything that Chris was teaching. This course was excellent, though it should be noted that it is not a World Religions course but a Religious Studies one. Emphasis on the philosophy behind religions and the questions they bring forth/try to answer. Very interesting, lots of discussion, one paper and a final exam.
Cris is a great Prof but the course was a lot of work... many complex concepts to deal with!
